alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 08 at 3:01PM AKST until November 09 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 6 inches. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula, mainly from Clam Gulch north. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be hazardous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow this morning is expected to become heavier by late afternoon. Several inches of snow accumulation is expected through late Wednesday evening before a changeover to rain sometime after midnight. The rain could be heavy Thursday morning causing very slick roads with rain on ice as well as ponding of water. There is a chance the precipitation type remains mostly snow which would result in higher snowfall amounts, but it looks more likely rain will be the predominant precipitation type Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
